claim: In the 2016 season, Piast Gliwice had the lowest number of home defeats among all teams.
extra_info: home team lost the matches refers to SUBTRACT(home_team_goal, away_team_goal) < 0; 2016 season refers to season = '2015/2016';
reasoning: Piast Gliwice had 1 home defeat in the 2015/2016 season (where home_team_goal < away_team_goal). The minimum number of home defeats among all teams that season was 1. While several other teams also had 1 home defeat, Piast Gliwice did indeed have the lowest number of home defeats. The claim does not assert uniqueness, so it is supported by the data.

content.text: Now let me query for Piast Gliwice and count home defeats for all teams in the 2015/2016 season.

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/european_football_2.sqlite" "SELECT T.team_long_name, COUNT(*) as home_defeats FROM Match M JOIN Team T ON M.home_team_api_id = T.team_api_id WHERE M.season = '2015/2016' AND M.home_team_goal < M.away_team_goal GROUP BY T.team_long_name ORDER BY home_defeats ASC LIMIT 20;"
input.description: Count home defeats per team in 2015/2016 season, sorted ascending

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/european_football_2.sqlite" "SELECT team_long_name FROM Team WHERE team_long_name LIKE '%Piast%' OR team_long_name LIKE '%Gliwice%';"
input.description: Check if Piast Gliwice exists in Team table

content.text: Piast Gliwice has 1 home defeat, but many other teams also have 1 home defeat. The claim says Piast Gliwice had "the lowest number" — they are tied with many other teams at 1 home defeat. They do have the lowest *count*, but they are not uniquely the lowest. Let me check if any team has 0 home defeats.

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/european_football_2.sqlite" "SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT T.team_long_name) FROM Match M JOIN Team T ON M.home_team_api_id = T.team_api_id WHERE M.season = '2015/2016' AND M.home_team_goal < M.away_team_goal AND T.team_long_name = 'Piast Gliwice';"
input.description: Verify Piast Gliwice home defeats count

input.command:
sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/european_football_2.sqlite" "
WITH home_defeats AS (
    SELECT T.team_long_name, COUNT(*) as defeats
    FROM Match M
    JOIN Team T ON M.home_team_api_id = T.team_api_id
    WHERE M.season = '2015/2016' AND M.home_team_goal < M.away_team_goal
    GROUP BY T.team_long_name
)
SELECT MIN(defeats) FROM home_defeats;"
input.description: Find the minimum number of home defeats

content.text:
Piast Gliwice had 1 home defeat in the 2015/2016 season, which is indeed the lowest number of home defeats (tied with several other teams). The claim says they had "the lowest number of home defeats among all teams." While they share this distinction with other teams, the claim doesn't say they were the *only* team with the lowest — it just says they had the lowest number. This is factually true: their 1 home defeat is tied for the minimum.

The minimum number of home defeats among all teams that season was 1. While several other teams also had 1 home defeat, Piast Gliwice did indeed have the lowest number of home defeats. The claim does not assert uniqueness, so it is supported by the data."}
